_comment: Created by EFisher on 03/12/2015 13:09:34 using v2.7
title: Has the distribution of sickness absence changed?
analysis_commentary: The largest percentage of staff took no (0) sickness days in all years (46.1% in 2011, 44.4% in 2012, 42.4% in 2013 and 46.5% in 2014); this means that over 50% of staff took at least one sickness day in each year. There has been a noticeable increase of 4.1 percentage points of the proportion of staff taking no sickness days from 2013 to 2014 and a decrease in the proportion of staff taking more than 4.1 sickness days; this would in part explain the decrease in the average (mean) sickness days per employee we saw in figure 1.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Personal Social Services: Staff of Social Services Departments
